alert.note: Alert for Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 8:06AM CDT until March 24 at 1:55PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas... Saline River At Benton affecting Saline County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saline River At Benton. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Commercial and industrial facilities in the flood plain along the left bank may be affected. Water is deep in the pastures along the west bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 21.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 7 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Crest Time Date Saline River Benton 18.0 13.3 Tue 7 AM 18.7 8.2 6.1 21.5 1 AM 3/23 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
